server

Class ClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • server.ClientHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ClientHandler
extends java.lang.Thread
    A handler for a client connected to the server. The handler receives incoming messages from the Client and can send messages to the Client.
    Author:
    Bas Hendrikse

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void announce()
      Send a message to all users that a new Client is connected.
      java.lang.String getClientName() 
      ServerGame getServerGame() 
      void run()
      Reads the messages formatted as agreed in the protocol from the socket connection.
      void sendAcceptRequest(java.lang.String mark)
      Sends a confirmation the the Client that it may connect to the server.
      void sendBoard()
      Sends the current Board parsed a String of the game to the Client.
      void sendEndGame(java.lang.String reason)
      Sends a message to the Client that the game is over, including the winner of the game and the reason of endgame.
      void sendFailedMoveResult(int index)
      Sends a message to the Client that the requested move failed including the player's name who did the move and the next player which is the player who tried to do a move.
      void sendInvalidCommand()
      Sends a message to the Client that the command isn't known by the server.
      void sendInvalidMove()
      Sends a message to the Client that the move which is requested is not valid.
      void sendInvalidUsername()
      Sends a message to the Client that the name with which the user is trying to connect contains invalid characters.
      void sendInvalidUserTurn()
      Sends a message to the Client who tried to do a move, but whose turn it isn't.
      void sendMessage(java.lang.String msg)
      Sends a message to the Client.
      void sendRematchConfirm()
      Sends a confirmation to the Client that the match can be reset and the Client is playing against the same oponent again.
      void sendStartGame()
      Sends a message to the Clients to start the game with the given players.
      void sendSuccesfulMoveResult(int index)
      Sends a message to the Client that the requested move was succesful including the player's name who did the move and the next player.
      void sendTurn()
      Sends the name of the player whose turn it currently is.
      void sendUsernameInUse()
      Sends a message to the Client that the name with which the Client is trying to connect is already in use.
      void setServerGame(ServerGame game)
      Sets the server game.
